verses.text_plain: Now it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html: 1Now it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.

tokens.text: Now it came to pass after this

verses.text_plain: And David said, I will shew kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father shewed kindness to me. And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
verses.verse_html: 2And David said, I will shew kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father shewed kindness to me. And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.

verses.text_plain: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? are not his servants come unto thee for to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?
verses.verse_html:
3But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? are not his servants come unto thee for to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land? ▼
▼ Thinkest…: Heb. In thine eyes doth David, etc

tokens.text: unto thee? are not his servants

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Thinkest…: Heb. In thine eyes doth David, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Thinkest…: Heb. In thine eyes doth David, etc

verses.text_plain: Wherefore Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the midst hard by their buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.verse_html: 4Wherefore Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the midst hard by their buttocks, and sent them away.

verses.text_plain: Then there went certain, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them: for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.
verses.verse_html: 5Then there went certain, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them: for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.

verses.text_plain: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syria–maachah, and out of Zobah.
verses.verse_html:
6And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syria–maachah, and out of Zobah. ▼
▼ odious: Heb. to stink

tokens.text: that they had made themselves odious

footnotes.body_html: ▼ odious: Heb. to stink

verses.text_plain: So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people; who came and pitched before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.
verses.verse_html: 7So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people; who came and pitched before Medeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.

verses.text_plain: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
verses.verse_html: 8And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.

verses.text_plain: And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array before the gate of the city: and the kings that were come were by themselves in the field.
verses.verse_html: 9And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array before the gate of the city: and the kings that were come were by themselves in the field.

verses.text_plain: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose out of all the choice of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
verses.verse_html:
10Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose out of all the choice of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians. ▼
▼ the battle…: Heb. the face of the battle was
 , ▼
▼ choice: or, young men

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the battle…: Heb. the face of the battle was
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the battle…: Heb. the face of the battle was
▼ choice: or, young men

verses.text_plain: And the rest of the people he delivered unto the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
verses.verse_html:
11And the rest of the people he delivered unto the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against the children of Ammon. ▼
▼ Abishai: Heb. Abshai

verses.text_plain: And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
verses.verse_html: 12And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.

tokens.text: for me, then thou shalt help
for thee, then I will help

verses.text_plain: Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for the cities of our God: and let the Lord do that which is good in his sight.
verses.verse_html: 13Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for the cities of our God: and let the Lord do that which is good in his sight.

tokens.text: and let us behave ourselves valiantly

verses.text_plain: So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh before the Syrians unto the battle; and they fled before him.
verses.verse_html: 14So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh before the Syrians unto the battle; and they fled before him.

verses.text_plain: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 15And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.

verses.text_plain: And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the river: and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them.
verses.verse_html:
16And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the river: and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them. ▼
▼ river: that is, Euphrates
 , ▼
▼ Shophach: also called, Shobach

tokens.text: that they were put to the worse

footnotes.body_html: ▼ river: that is, Euphrates
▼ Shophach: also called, Shobach

verses.text_plain: And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel, and passed over Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
verses.verse_html: 17And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel, and passed over Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.

verses.text_plain: But the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians seven thousand men which fought in chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
verses.verse_html: 18But the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians seven thousand men which fought in chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.

verses.text_plain: And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and became his servants: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.
verses.verse_html: 19And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, and became his servants: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.

tokens.text: that they were put to the worse
